comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This photo appeared in Hardware World for April, 1916, in an article about Ada Schilling with the title "Lack of Physical Strength No Obstacle to Feminine Achievement". According to the article, she was 4'11" and weighed 95 pounds. She had been trap shooting for 3 years and had many trophies, including "lady championship of California and the Pacific Coast." books.google.com/books?id=pC86AQAAMAAJ&pg=PA96&lp... In this 1917 newspaper article, she encouraged other women to take up the sport, and is also identified as being from Portland, Oregon: news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1144&dat=19170623&... This 1919 article says she had relocated to Portland from San Jose, California and was married to another professional shooter, Carl Schilling. oregonnews.uoregon.edu/lccn/sn83045782/1918-11-03/ed-1/se... In 1911, Carl and Ada had a sharpshooting theatrical act that involved such feats as lighting a match with one shot and putting it out with the next. www.library.illinois.edu/dnc/Default/Skins/APE/Client.asp... The San Francisco Call ran a profusely illustrated article about the Schillings and their shooting prowess, including a photo of the diminutive Ada shooting while being held across her husband's arms: cdnc.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/cdnc?a=d&d=SFC19090711.2.165.7#

comment.author: 12814971@N00
comment._content: Yeh- shotgun. The trap targets are a dead give away.

comment.author: 77924145@N04
comment._content: Mrs. Ada Schilling with a Remington Model 10 shotgun!!! NOT A RIFLE!!!! Although with her abilities she could probably hit trap targets with both a rifle or a shotgun.

comment.author: 12814971@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77924145@N04] Well done! I figured somebody would know the make and model of the shotgun.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Very well done, all of you.  Thank you for your close attention to detail. We'll make the correction to the caption and add some of the information you've found to the record the next time we update.
